instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.R7402: What is R7402? Resistor between PPVIN_S0_CPUIMVP and CPUIMVP_TON. TON stands for TIME ON â€“ CPUIMVP_TON configures the buck converter for the CPU based on its input power supply. If this resistor is blown, the machine will turn on but not have any image, chime, or POST, because CPU vcore will be missing. This resistor is often the first to corrode because it is along a high voltage rail and it is right on the edge of the board, check this on 2011-2012 model Macbook Pros that turn on and do not chime. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> White Light, no Chime
threads.message: History of liquid damage. Cleaned and now we have a fan spin but no video. After a few seconds the fan speed starts to get a little faster. No beeps with RAM installed but also no beeps with RAM not installed. SMC and PRAM reset performed. Nothing replaced yet because I'm not sure where to start with these symptoms. Just looking for some guidance. Thanks!

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> White Light, no Chime
threads.message: Do you have the bass speaker plugged in?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> White Light, no Chime
threads.message: Yeah I tried it with everything plugged in and also everything unplugged (besides charger and LCD) and same symptoms both ways

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> White Light, no Chime
threads.message: if you plug in external mouse do u have a light on the bottom of the mouse?

[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 17920"]Vcore present on L7510?[/QUOTE]

No, and also .005 in Diode mode

[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> White Light, no Chime
threads.message: Wasn't corroded but one end was disconnected from the pad. Replaced anyways and its working again. Thanks! Do you mind a brief explanation as to how you were able to find out that was the culprit?
